meanings.definition: A structure in fungi that bears spores
meanings.sent1: The carpophores of the mushroom release tiny spores into the air.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study the carpophores of different fungi to understand their reproductive process.
meanings.sent3: The carpophores of the mold seemed to dance in the breeze, spreading spores everywhere.
meanings.sent4: The carpophores of the fungus stood tall like miniature towers, ready to disperse their spores.
meanings.sent5: Under the microscope, the carpophores appeared like delicate spore carriers, each one a tiny world of reproduction.

meanings.definition: A stalk that supports a fruiting body in certain plants
meanings.sent1: The carpophores of the apple tree held the ripe fruits high above the ground.
meanings.sent2: Gardeners prune the carpophores of tomato plants to ensure proper fruit development.
meanings.sent3: The carpophores of the pumpkin plant swayed gently in the wind, carrying the heavy fruits.
meanings.sent4: The carpophores of the grapevine twisted and turned, showcasing clusters of juicy grapes.
meanings.sent5: Each carpophore of the strawberry plant bore a single sweet fruit, ready for picking.
